page.title: 02FARMING - BURGHFIELD
page.content: Home Farm consists of six-hundred acres and is used for breeding dairy cattle and growing cereal. Fresian cows are kept; they are milked in a herring-bone parlour which is so called because from the top view it looks like a herring's spine. We went to see some silage and it smelt like very sour vinegar. We then went to see some calves which were only two days old. There were fifty calves in the shed and each one had a pen only four or five times bigger than itself. Next we went to see the Beef house where all the one-year old bulls are kept. They were just about to be slaughtered. We next saw a fourteen hundred-weight bull who was led by a rope from a ring in his nose.
